intro: Piptothrix palmeri, commonly known as the Palmer's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils or disturbed areas. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in cyathia, a type of modified inflorescence typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. The leaves are usually simple, opposite, and have a waxy surface to reduce water loss.
